bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1941

div1.p: Truby appreciates Hench's comments on the manuscript. He is sending photographs taken in Cuba. He has almost decided on the title for his book: Memoir of Walter Reed and the Great Yellow Fever Episode.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1941

opener.dateline:
145 Laurel St
S. F. Calif.
Nov. 20 /41

div1.p:
Your Express package and also
reprints came on the 17th and I want
to thank you for them. As soon as I
have time I will give you a detailed
reply to all of the comments you made
on the Mms. They are all most constructive
and I appreciate them very much indeed-

I will inclose a picture of a Dougherty
Wagon. It does not look very attractive
with the curtains down, but it was a
light, very sturdy contraption which
mules could snake along over good
roads at a pace that would makes your
hair stand on end. I had such a ride
in one in 1904 on the Yosemite trails. No
Auto, Airplane or Speed boat rides have
even thrilled me so much-

I wonder if you could have negatives
made for me of your picture of the 2d Div
Hospital and building 108 (Med. Off. qrs.) My
print of the latter is very poor and probably
will not reproduce well. Yours may be better,

I am sure I made took a photo. Of the
building with our group on the porch but
most unfortunately I can't find it- I was
quite an amature photographer in those days
having taken a course at Cornell when
I was in College there. So in Cuba I took
many pictures and have some of them
still, but not the most important one,s
will inclose a few which you may keep-
I will also be pleased to have the negative
of the Toucha Hotel-

I am off now to a Thanksgiving dinner
and will have to close. Hope you
and your have a Happy Thanksgiving too.

closer.seg:
P. S. I have about decided on this
tittle for the book
Memoir of Walter Reed
and the
Great Yellow Fever Episode-
What do you think of it.
AET
